title: The Fate of Those Who Follow Lucifer
html:
2 Nephi 24:21. "Prepare slaughter for his children . . . that they do not rise" This sounds pretty harsh at first, but our inspired footnotes soften it a bit: "Let not another evil generation arise and resume an evil regime" (Isaiah 14:21, footnote a).

Dualistically speaking, or speaking of "his children" as the children of Lucifer, we would note that those who have followed the evil spirit instead of the Holy Spirit become the children of the devil and that "the devil will not support his children at the last day" (Alma 30:60).

2 Nephi 24:22. "Cut off" We all hope our families will enjoy the Lord's promised blessings. Being "cut off" is synonymous with being excommunicated or denied eternal increase (see 1 Nephi 22:20; D&C 1:14; D&C 132:19).

2 Nephi 24:23. "Possession for the bittern" Another reference to the drastic change that will come upon the land of Babylon. Instead of beautiful cities, it will be inhabited by the bittern, which has also been translated as "owl," "hedgehog," and "porcupine." The "pools of water" refer to marshes or swamps. A "besom" is a broom.
